NAME NAME
udevd - event managing daemon udevd - event managing daemon
SYNOPSIS SYNOPSIS
udevd [--daemon] [--debug] [--children-max=] [--exec-delay=] [--reso lve-names=early|late|never] [--version] [--help] udevd [--daemon] [--debug] [--children-max=] [--exec-delay=] [--reso lve-names=early|late|never] [--version] [--help]
DESCRIPTION DESCRIPTION
udevd listens to kernel uevents. For every event, udevd executes mat ching instructions specified in udev rules. See udev(7). udevd listens to kernel uevents. For every event, udevd executes mat ching instructions specified in udev rules. See udev(7).
On startup the content of the directory /lib/udev/devices is copied On startup the content of the directory /usr/lib/udev/devices is cop
to /dev. If kernel modules specify static device nodes, these nodes are cre ied to /dev. If kernel modules specify static device nodes, these nodes are
ated even without a corresponding kernel device, to allow on-demand loading created even without a corresponding kernel device, to allow on-demand loa
of ding
kernel modules. Matching permissions specified in udev rules are app of kernel modules. Matching permissions specified in udev rules are
lied to these static device nodes. applied to these static device nodes.
The behavior of the running daemon can be changed with udevadm contr ol. The behavior of the running daemon can be changed with udevadm contr ol.
OPTIONS OPTIONS
--daemon --daemon
Detach and run in the background. Detach and run in the background.
--debug --debug
Print debug messages to stderr. Print debug messages to stderr.

udev.exec-delay= udev.exec-delay=
Number of seconds to delay the execution of RUN instructions. Th is might be useful when debugging system crashes during coldplug cause by l oading non-working kernel modules. Number of seconds to delay the execution of RUN instructions. Th is might be useful when debugging system crashes during coldplug cause by l oading non-working kernel modules.
